turns.speaker: WINTER
turns.text: You know I've been over all this with Fedorchuk and Alterez this morning...

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Come on.  You got nothin' better to do, cushy county job like yours.

turns.speaker: WINTER
turns.text: Yeah, right.  Don't push your luck. Anyway, according to the sheet, the guy you nailed outside by the car--

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: The human?

turns.speaker: WINTER
turns.text: Yeah... he was one Martin Helder. White male, twenty-seven.  Let's see... wrap sheet shows one armed robbery conviction, a couple for sale of a controlled substance. Oh yeah, and he was wired on coke when you stopped his clock.

turns.speaker: WINTER
turns.text: No I.D. on him and -- well, you know, no fingerprints -- so it could be tough.  Your buddies this morning went through the mug book but couldn't make a facial match.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Fedorchuk couldn't find his ass with his hands in his back pockets.

turns.speaker: WINTER
turns.text: You took this gut out, too, didn't you?

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: WINTER
turns.text: Lucky for you, you got him in both of his... well, what we loosely refer to as... hearts.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Lucky nothing.  I had to empty my damn gun into him.

turns.speaker: WINTER
turns.text: That's the way these people are. You don't hit both pumps you just piss them off.

turns.speaker: WINTER
turns.text: Oh, here's an extra headshot if you need one.  We're just about to start cutting in.  You're welcome to stick around if you want.  It's really fascinating stuff.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Yeah, I'll bet.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: You guys finished the postmortem on Strader yet?

turns.speaker: WINTER
turns.text: You mean the Blob?  They're finishing up now.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: What kind of test?

turns.speaker: WINTER
turns.text: Looking for some foreign compound in the blood of that alien you dropped the other day.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Did he find anything?

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: Yeah, Sykes?

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Captain.  I'd like to volunteer for duty with the new detective.

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: You are to have nothing to do with the investigation into Bill Tuggle's death.  You know that.  Leave that for Fedorchuk.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Departmental policy.

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: You?

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: Granger and Pitts are already on it.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Granger and Pitts have one hell of a caseload... and I would have thought with Jetson here being the first Newcomer plainclothes, and Hubley's body being found over in the Newcomer community...

turns.speaker: WARNER
turns.text: Don't tell me what to think.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Hope their plumbing's the same.

turns.speaker: TUGGLE
turns.text: It is.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: How can I go?

turns.speaker: TUGGLE
turns.text: Put on your wash-and-wear suit and your clip-on tie, have your landlady tie your shoes for you, and show up at the church.  Simple.  Me and Carol are going.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: TUGGLE
turns.text: Hey, look -- we've known Kristin since... since she was conceived in that cabin up in Big Bear. Remember?  You and Edie banged the wall so hard, me and Carol were picking plaster out of our hair for a week...

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Goddammit, Tug -- I want to see Kristin get married, okay?  But--

turns.speaker: TUGGLE
turns.text: But you're bummed because your ex and her new husband are paying for the whole thing.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Shit, if Kristin had to get married where I could afford it, we'd be holding the reception at Buddy's Burgers.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Does that look at all suspicious to you?

turns.speaker: TUGGLE
turns.text: Whatever gave you that idea?

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: You got your vest?

turns.speaker: TUGGLE
turns.text: Of course.  Right in the trunk of the car.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Yeah, that's comforting.  Mine, too.

turns.speaker: TUGGLE
turns.text: Watch the driver.  I'm going for a better angle on the door.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: I got him.  Don't get pinned.

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: Get outta there!

turns.speaker: TUGGLE
turns.text: I can't!  Do you mind!

turns.speaker: SYKES
turns.text: I'll cover you!  Get outta there!!

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: This floor's freezing.

turns.speaker: APONE
turns.text: Christ.  I never saw such a buncha old women.  You want me to fetch your slippers, Hudson?

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: Would you, Sir?

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: Whoooah!  No shit?  I'm impressed.

turns.speaker: APONE
turns.text: Let's go...let's go.  Cycle through!

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: Hey, 'Top.'  What's the op?

turns.speaker: APONE
turns.text: Rescue mission.  There's some juicy colonists' daughters we gotta rescue from virginity.

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: Movement!

turns.speaker: APONE
turns.text: Position?

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: Can't lock up...

turns.speaker: APONE
turns.text: Talk to me, Hudson.

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: Uh, seems to be in front and behind.

turns.speaker: GORMAN
turns.text: ...that's better.  Pan it around a bit.

turns.speaker: APONE
turns.text: Awright.  Fire-team A.  Gear up. Let's move.  Two minutes. Somebody wake up Hicks.

turns.speaker: GORMAN
turns.text: Okay, let's do it.

turns.speaker: APONE
turns.text: Awright!  I want a nice clean dispersal this time.

turns.speaker: GORMAN
turns.text: Set down sixty meters this side of the telemetry mast.  Immediate dust off on my 'clear,' then stay on station.

turns.speaker: APONE
turns.text: Ten seconds, people.  Look sharp!

turns.speaker: GORMAN
turns.text: First squad up, on line.  Hicks, get yours in a cordon.  Watch the rear.

turns.speaker: APONE
turns.text: Vasquez, take point.  Let's move.

turns.speaker: GORMAN
turns.text: Flame-units only.  I want rifles slung.

turns.speaker: APONE
turns.text: Let's go.  Pull 'em out.

turns.speaker: GORMAN
turns.text: Uh,...Apone, I want you to lay down a suppressing fire with the incinerators and fall back by squads to the APC, over.

turns.speaker: APONE
turns.text: Say again?  All after incinerators?

turns.speaker: BISHOP
turns.text: I've isolated a neuro-muscular toxin responsible for the paralysis.  It seems to be metabolizing.  He should wake up soon.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Now let me get this straight. The aliens paralyzed the colonists, carried them over there, cocooned them to be hosts for more of those...

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Which would mean lots of those parasites, right?  One for each person...over a hundred at least.

turns.speaker: BISHOP
turns.text: Yes.  That follows.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: But these things come from eggs...so where are all the eggs coming from.

turns.speaker: BISHOP
turns.text: That is the question of the hour.  We could assume a parallel to certain insect forms who have hivelike organization. An ant of termite colony, for example, is ruled by a single female, a queen, which is the source of new eggs.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: You're saying one of those things lays all the eggs?

turns.speaker: BISHOP
turns.text: Well, the queen is always physically larger then the others.  A termite queen's abdomen is so bloated with eggs that it can't move at all.  It is fed and tended by drone workers, defended by the warriors.  She is the center of their lives, quite literally the  mother of their society.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Could it be intelligent?

turns.speaker: BISHOP
turns.text: Hard to say.  It may have been blind instinct...attraction to the heat of whatever...but she did choose to incubate her eggs in the one spot where we couldn't destroy her without destroying ourselves.  That's if she exists, of course.

turns.speaker: BISHOP
turns.text: That's it.  See it?  Emergency venting.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: How long until it blows?

turns.speaker: BISHOP
turns.text: I'm projecting total systems failure in a little under four hours.  The blast radius will be about thirty kilometers.  About equal to ten megatons.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: And it's too late to shut it down?

turns.speaker: BISHOP
turns.text: I'm afraid so.  The crash did too much damage.  The overload is inevitable, at this point.

turns.speaker: BISHOP
turns.text: I'll go.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BISHOP
turns.text: I'm really the only one qualified to remote-pilot the ship anyway. Believe me, I'd prefer not to.  I may be synthetic but I'm not stupid.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: All right.  Let's get on it.  What'll you need?

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: It's going to be closer.  You better get going.

turns.speaker: BISHOP
turns.text: See you soon.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: HOW MUCH TIME?

turns.speaker: BISHOP
turns.text: PLENTY!  TWENTY-SIX MINUTES!

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: WE'RE NOT LEAVING!

turns.speaker: BISHOP
turns.text: Ripley...

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: She's alive.  They brought her here and you know it.

turns.speaker: BISHOP
turns.text: In seventeen minutes this place will be a cloud of vapor the size of Nebraska.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: You did okay, Bishop.

turns.speaker: BISHOP
turns.text: Well, thanks, I --

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Fifty-seven...oh, Christ...

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: You'd drifted right through the core systems.  It's blind luck that deep-salvage team caught you when they...are you all right?

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Have they located my daughter yet?

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: Well, I was going to wait until after the inquest...

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Is she...?

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: Amanda Ripley-McClaren.  Married name, I guess.  Age:  sixty-six ...at time of death.  Two years ago.  I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Amy.

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: Cancer.  Hmmmm.  They still haven't licked that one.  Cremated.  Interred Parkside Repository, Little Chute, Wisconsin.  No children.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: You read my deposition...it's complete and accurate.

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: Look, I believe you, but there are going to be some heavyweights in there.  You got Feds, you got interstellar commerce commission, you got colonial administration, insurance company guys...

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: I get the picture.

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: Just tell them what happened.  The important thing is to stay cool and unemotional.

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: You had them eating out of your hand, kiddo.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: They had their minds made up before I even went in there. They think I'm a head case.

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: You are a head case.  Have a donut.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: No.  There's no way!

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: Hear me out...

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: I was reamed, steamed and dry-cleaned by you guys...and now you want me to go back out there?  Forget it.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: What about you?  What's your interest in this?

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: Well, the corporation co-financed that colony with the Colonial Administration, against mineral rights.  We're getting into a lot of terraforming...'Building Better Worlds.'

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Yeah, yeah.  I saw the commercial.

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: I heard you were working in the cargo docks.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: Running loaders, forklifts, that sort of thing?

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: It's all I could get.  Anyway, it keeps my mind off of... everything.  Days off are worse.

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: What if I said I could get you reinstated as a flight officer? And that the company has agreed to pick up your contract?

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: If I go.

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: If you go.  It's a second chance, kiddo.  And it'll be the best thing in the world for you to face this fear and beat it.  You gotta get back on the horse...

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Spare me, Burke.  I've had my psych evaluation this month.

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: Yes, and I've read it.  You wake up every night, sheets soaking, the same nightmare over and over...

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: No!  The answer is no.  Now please go.  I'm sorry.  Just go, would you.

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: Yello?  Oh, Ripley.  Hi...

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Burke, just tell me one thing. That you're going out there to kill them.  Not study.  Not bring back.  Just burn them out...clean ...forever.

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: That's the plan.  My word on it.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: You never said anything about an android being here!  Why not?

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: Well, it didn't occur to me.  It's been policy for years to have a synthetic on board.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: I hope you're right.  I really do.

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: I suggest you study the disks Ripley has been kind enough to prepare for you.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: That the atmosphere processor?

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: Uh-hunh.  One of thirty or so, all over the planet.  They're completely automated.  We manufacture them, by the way.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: They're right under the primary heat exchangers.

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: Yeah?  Maybe the organisms like the heat, that's why they built...

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: That's not what I mean.  Gorman, if your men have to use their weapons in there, they'll rupture the cooling system.

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: She's right.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: No good.  How do we know it'll effect their biochemistry?  I say we take off and nuke the entire site from orbit.  It's the only way to be sure.

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: Now hold on a second.  I'm not authorizing that action.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: Well, I mean...I know this is an emotional moment, but let's not make snap judgments.  Let's move cautiously.  First, this physical installation had a substantial dollar value attached to it --

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: They can bill me.  I got a tab running.  What's second?

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: This is clearly an important species we're dealing with here. We can't just arbitrarily exterminate them --

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Bullshit!

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: You son of a bitch.

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: Don't make me pull rank, Ripley.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: What rank?  I believe Corporal Hicks has authority here.

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: Corporal Hicks!?

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: This operation is under military jurisdiction and Hicks is next in chain of command.  Right?

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: Those specimens are worth millions to the bio-weapons division.  Now, if you're smart we can both come out of this heroes.  Set up for life.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: You just try getting a dangerous organism past ICC quarantine. Section 22350 of the Commerce Code.

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: You've been doing your homework. Look, they can't impound it if they don't know about it.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: But they will know about it, Burke. From me.  Just like they'll know how you were responsible for the deaths of one hundred and fifty-seven colonists here --

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: Now, wait a second --

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: You sent them to that ship.  I just checked the colony log... directive dates six-twelve-seventy-nine. Signed Burke, Carter J.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: You sent them out there and you didn't even warn them, Burke. Why didn't you warn them?

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: Look, maybe the thing didn't even exist, right?  And if I'd made it a major security situation, the Administration would've stepped in.  Then no exclusive rights, nothing.

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: I expected more of you, Ripley. I thought you would be smarter than this.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Sorry to disappoint you.

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: Look, we don't know what's going on out there.  It may just be a down transmitter.  But if it's not, I want you there...as an advisor.  That's all.

turns.speaker: GORMAN
turns.text: You wouldn't be going in with the troops.  I can guarantee your safety.

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: These Colonial Marines are some tough hombres, and they're packing state-of-the-art firepower. Nothing they can't handle...right, Lieutenant?

turns.speaker: GORMAN
turns.text: We're trained to deal with these kinds of situations.

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: Still nothing from the colony?

turns.speaker: GORMAN
turns.text: Dead on all channels.

turns.speaker: GORMAN
turns.text: Looks like you company can write off its share of this colony.

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: It's insured.

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: What's he scanning for?

turns.speaker: GORMAN
turns.text: PDT'S.  Personal-Data Transmitters. Every adult colonist had one surgically implanted.

turns.speaker: BURKE
turns.text: We're talking thermonuclear explosion.

turns.speaker: GORMAN
turns.text: Shit.  Apone, collect magazines from everybody.  We can't have any firing in there.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: How may drops is this for you, Lieutenant?

turns.speaker: GORMAN
turns.text: Thirty-eight...simulated.

turns.speaker: GORMAN
turns.text: Hold at forty.  Slow circle of the complex.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: The structure seems intact.  They have power.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: One of us?

turns.speaker: GORMAN
turns.text: Apone...where are your people? Anybody in D-Block?

turns.speaker: GORMAN
turns.text: Where are your parents?  You have to try...

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Gorman!  Give it a rest would you.

turns.speaker: GORMAN
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: GORMAN
turns.text: Proceed inside.

turns.speaker: GORMAN
turns.text: So.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: So...then the fusion containment shuts down.

turns.speaker: GORMAN
turns.text: So?  So?

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: GET THEM OUT OF THERE!  DO IT NOW!

turns.speaker: GORMAN
turns.text: Shut up.  Just shut up!

turns.speaker: GORMAN
turns.text: I told them to fall back...

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: They're but off!  Do something!

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: How do you feel?

turns.speaker: GORMAN
turns.text: All right, I guess.  One hell of a hangover.  Look, Ripley... I...

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Forget it.

turns.speaker: GORMAN
turns.text: At ease.  I'm sorry we didn't have time to brief before we left Gateway but...

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: Sir?

turns.speaker: GORMAN
turns.text: Yes, Hicks?

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: Hudson, Sir.  He's Hicks.

turns.speaker: GORMAN
turns.text: What's the question?

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: Is this going to be a stand-up fight, Sir, on another bug-hunt?

turns.speaker: GORMAN
turns.text: All we know is that there's still no contact with the colony and that a xenomorph may be involved.

turns.speaker: GORMAN
turns.text: Are there any questions?  Hudson?

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: How do I get out of this chicken-shit outfit?

turns.speaker: GORMAN
turns.text: All right, the area's secured. Let's go in and see what their computer can tell us.  First team head for operations. Hudson, see if you can get their CPU on line.  Hicks, meet me at the south lock by the up-link tower...

turns.speaker: GORMAN
turns.text: ...We're coming in.

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: He's coming in.  I feel safer already.

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: Sir, the CPU is on-line.

turns.speaker: GORMAN
turns.text: Okay, stand by in operations.  Let's go.

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: Hah!  Stop your grinnin' and drop your linen!  Found 'em.

turns.speaker: GORMAN
turns.text: Alive?

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: Unknown.  But, it looks like all of them.  Over at the processing station...sublevel 'C' under the south tower.

turns.speaker: GORMAN
turns.text: We're not making that out too well.  What is it?

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: You tell me.  I only work here.

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: Save it.

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: Sure, Hicks.

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: Let's get the fuck out of here!

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: Not that tunnel, the other one!

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: Well that's great!  That's just fucking great, man.  Now what the fuck are we supposed to do, man? We're in some real pretty shit now!

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: Are you finished?  You okay?

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: Outstanding.  Then all we need's a deck of cards.  All right, let's move like we got a purpose.

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: Aye-firmative.

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: We got problems.

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: I don't fucking believe this. Do you believe this?

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: Maybe we got 'em demoralized.

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: I want you two walking the perimeter. I know we're all in strung out shape but stay frosty and alert. We've got to stop any entries before they get out of hand.

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: The corner!  Ready?

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: Do it!

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: Seventeen meters.

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: Let's get these things lit.

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: Well you're not reading it right!

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: Six meters.  Five.  What the fu --

turns.speaker: HUDSON
turns.text: Let's go!  Let's go!

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: Fuckin' A!

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Removed surgically before embryo implantation.  Subject:  Marachuk, John L.   Died during procedure.  They killed him getting it off.

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: Poor bastard.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: How long after we're declared overdue can we expect a rescue?

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: About seventeen days.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: All right.  There's a fire door at this end.  The first thing we do is put a remote sentry in the tunnel and seal that door.

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: We gotta figure on them getting into the complex.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: That's right.  So we put up welded barricades at these intersections...  ...and seal these ducts here and here.  Then they can only come at us from these two corridors and we create a free field of fire for the other two sentry units, here.

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: They're in the approach corridor.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: On my way.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Now many?

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: Can't tell.  Lots.  D gun's down to twenty.  Ten.  It's out.

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: Newt time then can walk right up and knock.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: But they don't know that.  They're probably looking for other ways to get in.  That'll take them awhile.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: They'll get us.

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: Maybe.  Maybe not.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Hicks, I'm not going to wind up like those others.  You'll take care of it won't you, it if comes to that?

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: If it comes to that, I'll do us both.  Let's see that it doesn't Here, I'd like to introduce you to a close personal friend of mine.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: Well, that's the grenade launcher ...you probably don't want to mess with that.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Look, you started this.  Now show me everything.  I can handle myself.

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: Yeah.  I've noticed.

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: Wait a minute.  We'd know about it.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: The only way it would work is if he sabotaged certain freezers on the trip back.  Then he could jettison the bodies and make up any story he liked.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: You know, Burke, I don't know which species is worse.  You don't see them screwing each other over for a fucking percentage.

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: Let's waste him.  No offense.

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: It's game time.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Get back here, both of you.  Fall back to Operations.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: They learned.  They cut the power and avoided the guns.  They must have found another way in, something we missed.

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: We didn't miss anything.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: Locked.

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: Stand back.

turns.speaker: RIPLEY
turns.text: No!  No!  She's alive!  We have to --

turns.speaker: HICKS
turns.text: All right!  She's alive.  I believe it.  But we gotta get moving!  Now!
